New Records: The match set a new record for the most cards awarded in a single game at a European Championship with 18 cards.
Antonin Barak received the earliest sending-off in Euro’s history at 20 minutes, beating the previous record of 24 minutes held by Eric Abidal.
Key Match Events: Cenk Tosun scored the winning goal in injury time to secure Turkey's 2-1 victory.
Antonin Barak was sent off in the 20th minute after receiving a second yellow card.
Patrik Schick received a yellow card for dissent while not on the pitch.
Kenan Yildiz received a yellow card for a challenge on Robin Hranac.
Hakan Calhanoglu scored Turkey’s opener in the 51st minute.
Tomas Chory received a red card after the final whistle for a physical tussle with Mert Gunok.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was described as the dirtiest game in Euros history.
Turkey's exuberant celebrations at the final whistle led to a scuffle on the field.
The referee handed out five bookings in the aftermath of the game.
